definition: unstable/erratic/changeable/fickle
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
always/ever/often/frequently/common/general/constant
surname Chang

sentences.english: Is disease of department of gynaecology gotten capricious ?
sentences.chinese: 婦科病一得就反覆無常嘛？

sentences.english: Some clients feel like you exist solely to cater to their every whim.
sentences.chinese: 一些客戶認爲你應該完全迎合他們的反覆無常。

sentences.english: It is given to all sorts of caprices of wind and weather.
sentences.chinese: 經常遇到各種各樣反覆無常的風和天氣。

sentences.english: It's clear that some stocks are more volatile than others.
sentences.chinese: 很明顯有一些股票會比其他股票反覆無常。

sentences.english: Volatile law and order situation also dishearten foreign tourists.
sentences.chinese: 反覆無常的法律和社會秩序也使遊客同樣感到沮喪。

sentences.english: The ground is capricious like elephantine cat, the disposition of persist one's old ways.
sentences.chinese: 象貓一樣地反覆無常，我行我素的性格。

sentences.english: It is harder to negotiate safe passage with increasingly unpredictable armed groups.
sentences.chinese: 和愈加反覆無常的武裝組織商定安全通道越發困難。

sentences.english: During inspiration plunder or in the process of creation, play fast and loose is its form of expression.
sentences.chinese: 在靈感掠取或創作過程中，反覆無常是它的表現形式。

sentences.english: A hailstorm in July is a caprice of nature.
sentences.chinese: 七月天的一場冰雹是大自然的反覆無常的變化。

sentences.english: In the tumult of battle, robots wouldn't be affected by volatile emotions.
sentences.chinese: 身處混亂的戰場，機器人不會被反覆無常的情緒左右。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor's rule is orderly and without caprice.
sentences.chinese: 玉帝的規則是井然有序，不會反覆無常的。

sentences.english: He was rather too indulgent in humouring her caprices.
sentences.chinese: 講到容忍她的反覆無常，他實在是太遷就了。

sentences.english: Many of these assets were funded by lenders in fickle wholesale markets.
sentences.chinese: 許多這些資產來自反覆無常的批發市場。

sentences.english: He was very changeable, often blowing hot and cold.
sentences.chinese: 他朝三暮四，老是反覆無常。

sentences.english: Hermia was looking at him and wondering at his strange inconstancy.
sentences.chinese: 赫米亞望着他，對他莫名其妙的反覆無常感到很驚奇。

definition: see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
shameful secret
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
